snippet: Not long after the deer was offered a last-minute reprieve by the governor, the city said it planned to put it to death on Friday morning, calling it “the only humane and safe recourse.”...
abstract: Reprieve from 'death row' given by New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo to deer living in Harlem park is short lived after deer escapes into nearby housing project; city officials say they have no other option, since they cannot release it back into city and relocating animal to wilderness is not possible.
lead_paragraph: Not long after the deer was offered a last-minute reprieve by the governor, the city said it planned to put it to death on Friday morning, calling it “the only humane and safe recourse.”

headline.main: Captured Harlem Deer Gets a Reprieve, but Faces Death Hours Later
headline.print_headline: Captured Harlem Deer Gets Reprieve, but Faces Death Hours Later
